Column Comment.0: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.1: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.2: COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found in the PPDMschema
Column Comment.3: VALUE: the allowed value for the check constraint column. For %_IND columns, thevalues may be "Y", "N" or null.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CHECK CONSTRAINT NAME: the name of the check constraint, if applicable.
Column Comment.6: CONSTRAINT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a check constraint.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: EXTENSION INDICATOR: The PPDM Association strongly discourages the creationof new check constraint values. If you decide to add values, please forward yourchanges to changes@ppdm.org and set this column to Y. If you create a new checkconstraint value for a super-sub type table, you must also create a definition for thesub type table.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: VALUE LONG NAME: the full or decoded version of the value of the checkconstraint. For %_IND columns, the value of Y is YES, and the value of N is NO.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
